result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaylen J. Ghani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $15,642.46 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: ***AJOC - Probation amended to 1 yr on Ct 2.***

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim M.P. appeared.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2; credit for 2 days served if revoked; deft to pay restitution of $15,642.46 (by stipulation of deft), to be paid out to victim J.L. first, then to victim M.P. second, then to insurance companies; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge; bond applied to restitution, bond from file 16CF265 applied to restitution.  No contact w/Victims.
from Atty Kmiec
Sentencing hearing on August 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Due to an ongoing jury trial in Br. 6, sentencing on 7/20/16 at 1:30 is reset for 8/12/16 at 10:30.
Amended Info.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T. Kmiec.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  State files amended information.  Atty Kmiec acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft. pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds deft guilty of counts 1 and 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH set for 7/20/16 @ 1:30. Bond continued.
State's second amended list of witnesses and demand for discovery; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State's joinder motion.  Atty Kmiec opposes motion.  Court grants joinder motion for reasons set forth on the record.  JS remains set for 5/23/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
for joinder; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Kmiec the MH of 4/5/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as ADA McNeill still needs to file joinder motion and the parties are still negotiating; reset to 4/28/16 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Kmiec states there has been a new case scheduled for preliminary hearing on 3/22/16.  ADA McNeill states that the offer was extended, unsure if cases will be resolved.  Joinder motion set for 4/5/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  STC continued to 3/17/16 at 2pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill states that Atty Kmiec needs time to review new information w/deft to see if this case can be resolved, if not resolved the State will be issuing new charges.  STC 3/3/16 at 1:15pm and JS set for 5/23/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter is not resolved.  Attorney Kmiec requests this case remain on the court's trial calendar.  Jury selection scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 8:30am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill states she believes the parties are stipulating to an adjournment of the trial.  Atty Kmiec agrees.  Court grants adjournment of JS to 2/22/16 at 8:30am and JSH 2/3/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Kmiec the JS of 8/18/15 at 8:30am is adjourned by stipulation due to witness availability issues; reset to 12/14/15 at 8:30am.

and  Demand for Discovery

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Kmiec's motion to reconsider ruling on the suppression motion.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Atty Kmiec states he may be requesting a Daubert hearing.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.
With Atty Kmiec and by agreement of ADA McNeill the MH of 3/24/14 at 1:30pm is set over to the JSH on 5/7/15, time is changed from 1:15pm to 2:30pm.
Motion hearing on March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Kmiec

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Kmiec's motion to suppress.  Witnesses are sequestered.  ADA McNeill argues there is no basis for the motion.  Court denies motion without a hearing for reasons set forth on the record.  Atty Kmiec may file motion to reconsider in 3 weeks.  Court adjourns JS from 4/13/15 at 9am, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar, to 5/26/15 at 9am, pick & go; JSH 5/7/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
